g.text: 3043(N) vs 3059(H) “Ryanair Strike” Thread AUS, Taliban agree to preliminary peace framework: report.1.U.S. and Taliban Agree in Principle to Peace Framework, Envoy Says. The U.S. negotiator, Zalmay Khalilzad, says that finalizing a deal would hinge on a cease-fire and Taliban talks with Afghans, which they are discussing now.2.U.S. And Taliban Agree To Framework For Peace Deal.U.S. and Taliban peace talks have produced a tentative agreement, which would see a pullout of American troops in exchange for a ceasefire and talks with the Afghan government that could potentially bring an end to America’s longest war.3.Facing U.S. withdrawal, Afghan leader pitches Trump cost savings. Trump has long been clear on desire to pull troops out of long-running wars, but President Ghani knows he still desperately needs U.S. helpThread B1.U.S. and Taliban Agree in Principle to Peace Framework, Envoy Says. The U.S. negotiator, Zalmay Khalilzad, says that finalizing a deal would hinge on a cease-fire and Taliban talks with Afghans, which they are discussing now.2.Facing U.S. withdrawal, Afghan leader pitches Trump cost savings. Trump has long been clear on desire to pull troops out of long-running wars, but President Ghani knows he still desperately needs U.S. help3.Taliban say Moscow talks with Afghan politicians 'very successful'. It was the second time President Ashraf Ghani was frozen out of such talks in recent weeks.4.In Moscow, Afghan Peace Talks Without the Afghan Government. The Taliban broached their views on women’s rights at a meeting with Afghan officials. But President Ashraf Ghani remained sidelined from talks.
